title: Katie Price faces bankruptcy by Christmas after allegedly failing to keep up repayments
text:

Katie Price is facing bankruptcy by Christmas after allegedly failing to pay back her spiralling debts.

The mum of five, 41, had taken out an individual voluntary arrangement (IVA) 12 months ago and was supposed to be paying off £12,000 a month to her various creditors.

But the 41-year-old former glamour model allegedly failed to satisfy the terms of her debt plan and last month a bankruptcy charge was laid on her West Sussex mansion.

Today at the Insolvency and Companies Court, Judge Sally Barber ordered Price to be served with a draft petition notice within seven days.

(Image: Brett D. Cove / Splash News)

She will then have to return to the same court next month to hear whether she will be made bankrupt.

Mr Taylor from JMW Solicitors told the judge he had been in email contact with Price in the last two and a bit weeks, but she had failed to attend an appointment with her creditors.

"Technically it’s not an adjournment so I'm extending time," said Judge Barber.

"Service will be effective on the expiry of seven days of completion of such sending of the email and such posting.

(Image: officialkatieprice/Instagram)

"Once you've done both, service will be effective on the expiry of seven days.

"I also extend the time for hearing the bankruptcy petition - I think six weeks."

Price will return to the insolvency court on on November 27.

A spokesman for HMRC, which is believed to be one of Katie's creditors, said they would not comment on individual cases.

In recent months, Katie has splurged on holidays abroad, home renovation projects and multiple rounds of plastic surgery, which she hinted she was getting for a reduced rate or for free in exchange for Instagram exposure of the clinic in question.

(Image: Instagram)

Just last week, Katie was slapped with a two-year driving ban for failing to tell police who was behind the wheel of her notorious pink Range Rover after a boozy night out last October.

The Barbie pink 4x4 was found crashed in a hedge with Price in the passenger seat wearing just a hoodie and socks and no underwear.

At her court case, she insisted a mystery male friend of her partner Kris Boyson had been driving at the time of the crash but had run off before officers arrived.

She was cleared of drink-driving but convicted of being drunk in charge of a motor vehicle, handed a fine and a three-month ban.

Price was taken back to court last week where she was found guilty of failing to give police information about the driver when required.

The two-year ban means she won't be allowed back behind the wheel until October 2021.
description: Mum of five Katie Price is being told to return to court in November to hear whether she'll be made bankrupt
